page.title: 02NATURE IN CROOKEDHOLM
page.content: Crookedholm has been a countryside village for years. The dam on the nearby river has caused many problems in the last few years by killing man and nature because of its depth. We have tackled this problem by blowing up the dam and letting the River Irvine flow freely to the sea. There have been no deaths since. Beside it there are rabbits, hares and lots of birds. The River Irvine is in the shape of a horse-shoe and that is why Crookedholm got its name, the crooked bend. The dam and the countryside round about the area give many things to do. There's swimming, fishing, ferreting, coarsing and shooting. Crookedholm used to be an old Saxon village.
